item.description:
Clint Fuhs serves as seminar leader at Integral Institute; he is also an integral coach. Clint designed and taught one of the first undergraduate courses on integral theory and practice in the US. Clint lectures on topics ranging from Integral Post-Metaphysics to integral analysis of post-9/11 world affairs.

Clint also serves as the Partner Group and Curriculum Coordinator for Integral Institute. This position encompasses myriad roles including: workshop trainer, AQAL content review board lead, content and individual certification coordinator, seminar curriculum development, and partner relationship manager. Clint is currently working on a Ph.D. in Human and Organizational Development at Fielding Graduate University.

Clint will be offering this 3 hour workshop on
Sunday, July 29th
12-3

A Special Workshop on Advanced AQAL Theory
$25

~Critical Quadratic Distinctions? such as the correct usage of interior, exterior, inside, outside and internal and external.

~The 8 Zones as Perspectives- a cognitive exploration of 4 term integral calculus equations, which represent all possible 4-p in each of the 8 zones. Then we?ll participate in activities designed to engender a direct experience of these perspectives.

~Kosmic Address- What is it? How can we use it? How can we incorporate it into our practice?

~Dual Center of Gravity of the Self- A glimpse at Ken?s newest (yet to be published!) work. Clint will lead us in delving deeper into human development through states and stages, including: fulcrums (transitions vertically in altitude), switch-points (transitions horizontally through states) and the interaction of altitudes (levels) and states in terms on their impact the development of the individual.
item.name: Special Advanced AQAL Workshop with Clint Fuhs
